_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Someone who doesn’t guard the sense door: Sees a sight with their eyes
Holds on to pleasant sights and dislikes unpleasant ones
Lives with mindfulness of the body unestablished and a restricted heart
Doesn’t truly understand the freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom where those arisen bad, unskillful qualities cease without anything left over
The same pattern repeats for hearing, smelling, tasting, feeling, and knowing a thought
Someone who does guard the sense doors (: Sees a sight with their eyes
Doesn’t hold on to pleasant sights and doesn’t dislike unpleasant ones
Lives with mindfulness of the body established and a limitless heart
Truly understands the freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom where those arisen bad, unskillful qualities cease without anything left over
The same pattern repeats for hearing, smelling, tasting, feeling, and knowing a thought
